text: Aristotle believed that the Earth was the center of the universe, around which all heavenly bodies revolved.
In Aristotle's philosophy, the soul is the 'first actuality' of a living body — it is what makes an organism alive.
Aristotle developed formal logic based on the concept of syllogism, a form of reasoning where conclusions are drawn from two premises.
Aristotle proposed that all matter is composed of four elements: earth, water, air, and fire.
According to Aristotle, humans are rational animals, distinguished from other beings by their capacity for reason.
Aristotle classified governments into three types: monarchy, aristocracy, and polity, based on who rules and for whose benefit.
Aristotle made significant contributions to ethics, proposing the concept of the 'Golden Mean' — virtue lies between extremes.
